messages.content:
Dear Gen AI Community,

I hope this message finds you well.

I wanted to take a moment to share that I had a very warm and appreciative conversation with Irene earlier this evening to thank her for the contributions sheâ€™s made to our community. Irene brought energy, initiative, and passion to her involvement, and we are grateful for the time and effort she dedicated.

As we continue to nurture this community around shared values of collaboration, curiosity, and inclusive growth, weâ€™ve mutually agreed that Irene will be stepping away from her role. While we may at times take different paths, we remain committed to fostering a culture where all voices can thrive within a spirit of alignment and mutual support.

Please feel free to DM me Â if you have any questions. Letâ€™s continue building something extraordinary together.

Warmly,
Dragana

Dear Non-Coders Community,

Weâ€™re currently going through a brief reorganization to strengthen and continue the important work that has been unfolding in this cherished space. Iâ€™m thrilled to share that Ash and Apoorv will be joining to support this next phase, helping us bring even more clarity, structure, and alignment with the broader Gen AI Global ecosystem.

As part of this transition, weâ€™ll be updating a few key elements and will release the new interest form as soon as possible. Our goal is to ensure the Non-Coders program becomes a seamless foundation leading into the Agent Development Program for Discord 2.0â€”offering everyone a natural, supportive learning journey.

Weâ€™ll also be announcing a dedicated meeting soon to walk you through next steps and answer questions live. In the meantime, if you have any doubts or would like to connect, feel free to DM me directly anytime.

Thanks so much for your understanding, enthusiasm, and continued support!

Rodrigo Reyes

Dear @Non-Coders Community,

As mentioned earlier, weâ€™d like to share a few updates on the next steps for this group. After meeting with <@1360639641556090894>  and <@1335299567440367757>, weâ€™ve initiated a light reorganization to continue building on the incredible work thatâ€™s already been unfolding hereâ€”this time with stronger alignment to the broader roadmap being led by Dr. Sanchez.

If you havenâ€™t seen it yet, we invite you to check out the announcement Amber posted yesterday at 3:59 PM EST in the #announcements-community channel. It outlines the Agent Development Class, which this Non-Coders track will now seamlessly feed intoâ€”becoming a natural and supported entry point into the larger learning journey with Gen AI Global.

To support this transition, weâ€™re preparing a 6â€“8 module learning experience, modeled similarly to AGAI. You can expect live weekly sessions, hands-on assignments for each module, and the opportunity to apply what youâ€™re learning to real-world use cases. Toward the end of the course, youâ€™ll even get to showcase your tools, ideas, and co-created solutions with your peersâ€”helping to shape the course collectively.

In parallel, weâ€™ll continue collecting and organizing community-generated tools, resources, and best practices for Non-Coders. These contributions will be curated into accessible repositories, making it easier for everyone to grow and learn together.

As part of this reorganization, weâ€™ll be releasing a new interest form tailored specifically for the Non-Coders group. Your input will help us personalize this experience as much as possibleâ€”so weâ€™d love for everyone to fill it out once it goes live.

To give everyone a clearer picture of how this track interfaces with the broader program, please note the following:

The Non-Coders track exists primarily to track your learning pace through multiple data pointsâ€”video recordings submitted to our repository, your chat interactions, and the Google Form you initially filled out to join the Agent Development Course. The goal is to use this data to place you into the most ideal cohort for the first official stage: Discord Managers. Youâ€™ll be matched with others who learn at a similar pace, ensuring balanced and efficient group progress. A team of MIT alumni, working in collaboration with the SGU program and personally recommended by Dr. Sanchez, will be facilitating this data collection and execution to create the cohorts.  

While the Non-Coders course spans 6â€“8 weeks with a session per week, we plan to begin onboarding you into the Discord Manager stage within just one week. That said, you can and are encouraged to continue attending the weekly Non-Coders sessions as a supplemental resource even after starting Discord Managers.

Thank you again for your ongoing support, enthusiasm, and commitment to this learning community. Weâ€™re incredibly excited about whatâ€™s ahead and canâ€™t wait to build this next chapter with you.

Warm regards,
The Non-Coders Team
Gen AI Global

Welcome to Step One: Non-Coding Learners Access Granted!
<@1335299567440367757> <@1360639641556090894> <@1247410151737131009> @darkgago <@1311434218622156850> <@1125194882164736050> @nura775 

Hi everyone! Youâ€™ve officially been added to the Non-Coding Learners group â€” this is Step One in your training journey for the 2025 Discord Manager / Agent Development Class at MIT Gen AI Global.

As we finalize instructor placement, cohort matching, and scheduling, this space gives you early access to learning tools and materials, community engagement, and foundational preparation. Your full course begins soon, but this early access ensures youâ€™re already on track.

Next steps:
    â€¢    Fill out your Non-Coders Learning Form â€” this will be sent shortly by <@1125194882164736050>.
    â€¢    Watch for your learning pod assignment tonight at 9:00 PM EST. Iâ€™ll be announcing the pairings and creating group chats for each pod.

Get ready to dive in â€” weâ€™re so excited to start building with you! Thank you for being part of this amazing community @everyone !

Hi <@&1371647540709163130> Team

As we continue building a dynamic and collaborative learning journey together, we want to make sure this experience is as relevant and engaging as possible for everyone. To do that, we need your input!

What tools, platforms, or resources are you most interested in learning about-or even teaching to others?

Whether youâ€™re curious about a specific no-code platform, have experience with productivity tools, or want to dive deeper into AI-powered solutions, your suggestions will help us tailor the course content and community resource repository. This is also a fantastic opportunity for anyone who wants to share their expertise and support fellow learners by leading a session or creating a resource.

How you can contribute:

- Use the form below to share any tools or topics you want to learn.

- Reach out to Non Coders team if youâ€™re interested in teaching or co-hosting a session on something you know well.

- Donâ€™t hesitate to suggest tools youâ€™ve seen or heard about, even if youâ€™re new to them-this is a space to learn together!

[Here is the form â†’ https://forms.fillout.com/t/5ms47yR2fbus]


Your input will directly influence our upcoming modules, hands-on assignments, and the community resource repository weâ€™re building. The more you share, the richer our collective learning experience will be.

Thank you for helping us create a supportive, resourceful, and inspiring environment for all Non-Coders. We canâ€™t wait to see what tools and ideas you bring to the table!

Warm regards,
The Non-Coders Team

Hi @everyone 

First of all, thank you so much for your fantastic participation and insightful comments during todayâ€™s session! Your energy and engagement made it truly special, and we are excited to keep the momentum going.

As promised, here is everything you need to continue learning at your own pace:

ğŸ“‚ **Access Your Groupâ€™s Course Materials**
â€“ **Group 1 (Mondays):**
[https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1zyNdLys1kQ0wHX2En79m8pIALDOIkvre?usp=sharing]

â€“ **Group 2 (Saturdays):**
[https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1nHB8Hs8znM4FIDB8W9gUcIQnyuLI5FKo?usp=sharing]

Inside your folder, youâ€™ll find:

**Office Hours Slides** â€“ easy-to-follow, friendly learning material,
**Session Recordings** â€“ rewatch any class whenever you like,
**Assignments Folder** â€“ this is set up with restricted edit access, so only members of your group will receive an invite via email to upload their work. Each class will have its own assignment, released progressively.,

ğŸ’¡ **A Few Important Notes**

1. These assignments are optionalâ€”this isnâ€™t a formal course but rather a reinforcement and extension of what youâ€™ve already learned in your AGAI program. Feel free to engage as much or as little as you like!

2. We want this eight-module program to be flexible and shaped by your needs. If you have ideas for complementary topics or tools, please share themâ€”weâ€™re all ears!

3. The goal is to develop a personal, applied projectâ€”whether thatâ€™s starting something new or improving an existing ventureâ€”using the no-code AI tools we explore. This is purely for learning and community growth, not for profit. Our open-source spirit guides us all to collaborate, share, and build together.

Thank you again for your enthusiasm, curiosity, and commitment. Weâ€™re thrilled to have you in this community and look forward to watching everyone learn, experiment, and growâ€”together!

Warmest regards,
The Non-Coders Team
